column2: Average weekly earnings including overtime for all employees
Average weekly earnings for the industrial aggregate, excluding unclassified businesses [11-91N] in Alberta for February 2004, 2008 and 2012 have been corrected.

The quality indicators take into account various factors that affect the quality of the data, notably the CV, the non-response errors and the imputation errors. Quality indicators indicate the following: A - Excellent; B - Very good; C - Good; D - Acceptable; E - Use with caution; F - Too unreliable to publish or sample size is too small to produce reliable estimates.
Some series exhibit no clear seasonal pattern. In such cases the data are not adjusted.

Industrial aggregate covers all industrial sectors except those primarily involved in agriculture, fishing and trapping, private household services, religious organisations and the military personnel of the defence services.
Unclassified businesses (00) are businesses for which the industrial classification (North American Industry Classification System [NAICS] 2022 Version 1.0) has yet to be determined.
Excludes unclassified businesses unless otherwise mentioned.
The introduction of administrative data in 2001 and the associated change in methodology resulted in level shifts for some series. This affects the comparability of pre- and post-2001 estimates.
Estimates for the latest reference month are preliminary.
Earnings data are based on gross payroll before source deductions.
Average weekly earnings for the industrial aggregate, excluding unclassified businesses [11-91N] in Alberta for February 2004, 2008 and 2012 have been corrected.

The following variables for Canada, the provinces and territories have been corrected for January 2013: Employment for all employees for the industrial aggregate, excluding unclassified businesses [11-91N]; and Average weekly hours including overtime for hourly employees for the industrial aggregate, excluding unclassified businesses [11-91N].
Industry estimates in this table are based on the 2022 North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Version 1.0.
